BiblioData.Title: BRIGHTNESS ENHANCING FILM COMPRISING NANOCOMPOSITE STRUCTURE HAVING IMPROVED CRACK RESISTANCE
BiblioData.Abstract: Microstructured films such as brightness enhancing films, polymerizable resin compositions comprising an organic component and surface modified nanoparticles, and surface modified nanoparticles are described. The microstructured film has a polymerized structure comprising the reaction product of the polymerizable resin composition (e.g. having a refractive index of at least 1.58). The cured nanocomposite (e.g. structure) can exhibit improved crack resistance. In some embodiments, the flexibility is expressed in terms of a cylindrical mandrel bend test property (e.g. a mandrel size to failure of less than 6 mm or a mandrel size to failure according to the equation D = 1000(T/0.025-T) wherein T is the thickness in millimeters of a (e.g. preformed base layer). In other embodiments, the flexibility is expressed in terms of a tensile and elongation property (e.g. a tensile strength at break of at least 25 MPa and an elongation at break of at least 1.75%).

Claims.P: What is claimed is:

1. A brightness enhancing film having a polymerized structure comprising the reaction product of polymerizable resin composition having a refractive index of at least 1.58 comprising an organic component having at least one di(meth)acrylate aromatic monomer and at least 10 wt-% of surface modified inorganic nanoparticles wherein the brightness enhancing film has a mandrel size to failure of less than 6 mm.

2. A brightness enhancing film having a base layer and a polymerized structure disposed on the base layer wherein the polymerized structure comprises the reaction product of polymerizable resin composition having a refractive index of at least 1.58 comprising an organic component having at least one di(meth)acrylate aromatic monomer and at least 10 wt-% of surface modified inorganic nanoparticles wherein the brightness enhancing film has a mandrel size to failure according to the equation D = 1000(T/0.025-T) wherein T is the thickness of the base layer.

3. A brightness enhancing film having a polymerized structure comprising the reaction product of polymerizable resin composition having a refractive index of at least 1.58 comprising an organic component and at least 10 wt-% of surface modified inorganic nanoparticles wherein a cured film of the polymerizable resin composition has a tensile strength at break of at least 25 MPa and an elongation at break of at least 1.75%.

4. A brightness enhancing film having a polymerized structure comprising the reaction product of a polymerizable resin composition comprising an organic component comprising one or more ethylenically unsaturated monomer(s) or oligomer(s); and at least 10 wt-% inorganic nanoparticles surface modified with a first surface treatment comprising at least one monocarboxylic acid having a non- reactive compatibilizing group, and a second surface treatment comprising at least one non- volatile monocarboxylic acid having a copolymerizable group that reacts with the organic component; wherein the nanoparticles comprise the second surface treatment in a stoichiometric amount greater than the first surface treatment.

5. A brightness enhancing film having a polymerized structure comprising the reaction product of a polymerizable resin composition comprising an organic component comprising one or more monofunctional biphenyl monomers in an amount totaling at least 10 wt-% and at least 10 wt-% inorganic nanoparticles surface modified with a first surface treatment comprising at least one monocarboxylic acid having a water soluble tail, and a second surface treatment comprising at least one acrylate functionalized surface modifier prepared by the reaction of an aliphatic anhydride and a hydroxy alkyl acrylate.
6. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 3-5 wherein the brightness enhancing film has a mandrel size to failure of less than 6 mm.
7. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-5 wherein the polymerizable resin composition has a refractive index of at least 1.61.
8. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-5 wherein the polymerizable resin composition has a refractive index of at least 1.645.
9. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-4 wherein the organic component comprises at least one biphenyl monomer.
10. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 5 or 9 wherein the biphenyl monomer has a Mn of less than 450 g/mole.
11. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 5 or 9 wherein the biphenyl monomer has a viscosity of less than 500 cps at 60<0>C.
12. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 5 or 9 wherein the one or more biphenyl monomers are present in an amount ranging from 25 wt-% to 75 wt-% of the organic component.
13. The brightness enhancing film of claim 12 wherein the one or more biphenyl monomers are present in an amount ranging from 30 wt-% to 50 wt-% of the organic component.
14. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 5 or 9-13 wherein the biphenyl monomer has unsubstituted aromatic rings.
15. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 5 or 9-13 wherein the biphenyl monomer comprises a (meth)acrylate group.
16. The brightness enhancing film of claim 15 wherein the biphenyl monomer has the general formula:
wherein Rl is H or CH3; X is O or S; n ranges from 0 to 10; and
L is an alkyl group having 1 to 5 carbon atoms, optionally substituted with hydroxy.
17. The brightness enhancing film of claim 15 wherein the biphenyl monomer has the general formula:
wherein Rl is H or CH3;
X is O or S;
Q is selected from - (C(CH3)2-, -CH2, -C(O)-, -S(O)-, and -S(O)2-; n ranges from O to 10; and
L is an alkyl group having 1 to 5 carbon atoms, optionally substituted with hydroxy.
18. The brightness enhancing film of claims 15-17 wherein the biphenyl monomer comprises an acrylate group.

19. The brightness enhancing film of claim 18 wherein the biphenyl monomer is selected from the group consisting of 2-phenyl-phenyl acrylate, 4-(-2-phenyl-2-propyl)phenyl acrylate, 2-phenyl-2-phenoxyethyl acrylate, and mixtures thereof.
20. The brightness enhancing film of according to any one claims 3-5 wherein the organic component further comprises at least one difunctional ethylenically unsaturated monomer.
21. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-2 or 20 wherein the amount of difunctional ethylenically unsaturated monomer ranges from 5 wt-% to 80 wt-
% of the organic component.
22. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-2 or 20 wherein the difunctional ethylenically unsaturated monomer is an aromatic (meth)acrylate monomer.
23. The brightness enhancing film of claims 22 wherein the difunctional ethylenically unsaturated monomer comprises a major portion having the structure
wherein Rl is independently hydrogen or methyl,
R2 is independently H or Br,
Z is independently -C(CHs)2-, -CH2-, -C(O)-, -S-, -S(O)-, or -S(O)2-, and

L is a linking group independently selected from linear and branched C2- Ci2 alkyl groups wherein the carbon chain is optionally substituted with one or more oxygen group and/or the carbon atoms are optionally substituted with one or more hydroxyl groups.
24. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 5 or 8-19 wherein the organic component further comprises up to 25 wt-% of one or more mono functional
(meth)acrylate monomers having a refractive index lower than the biphenyl monomer.
25. The brightness enhancing film of any of the previous claims wherein the polymerizable resin comprises less than 5 wt-% of a crosslinker having at least three ethylenically unsaturated groups.

26. The brightness enhancing film of any of the previous claims wherein the inorganic nanoparticles comprise adsorbed non-reactive volatile acid and the acid content of the brightness enhancing film is less than 5 wt-%.
27. The brightness enhancing film of any of the previous claims wherein the polymerizable resin composition is free of silane surface treatments.
28. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-5 wherein the inorganic nanoparticles comprise a first surface treatment having the general formula:
CH3 -[O-(CH2)y ]x -X2 -(CH2)n -COOH
wherein X2 is selected from the group consisting of -O- , -S-, -C(O)O- and - C(O)NH; n ranges from about 1-3; x ranges from about 1-10; and y ranges from about 1-4.

29. The brightness enhancing film of claim 28 wherein the first surface treatment is selected from the group consisting of 2-[2-(2-methoxyethoxy)ethoxy] acetic acid, 2-(2- methoxyethoxy) acetic acid, succinic acid mono-[2-(2-methoxy-ethoxy)-ethyl] ester, maleic acid mono-[2-(2-methoxy-ethoxy)-ethyl] ester, and glutaric acid mono-[2-(2- methoxy-ethoxy)-ethyl] ester, succinic acid mono-2-[2-(2-methoxyethoxy)ethoxy] ethyl ester, and mixtures thereof.

30. The brightness enhancing film according to any one of claims 1-5 wherein the inorganic nanoparticles comprise a second surface treatment selected from the group consisting of succinic acid mono-(2-acryloyloxy-ethyl) ester, maleic acid mono-(2- acryloyloxy-ethyl) ester, and glutaric acid mono-(2-acryloyloxy-ethyl) ester, maleic acid mono-(4-acryloyloxy-butyl) ester, succinic acid mono-(4-acryloyloxy-butyl) ester, glutaric acid mono-(4-acryloyloxy-butyl)ester.
31. The brightness enhancing film of any of the previous claims wherein the amount of inorganic nanoparticles ranges from 40 wt-% to 60 wt-%.
32. The brightness enhancing film of any of the preceding claims wherein the inorganic nanoparticles have a refractive index of at least 1.68.
33. The brightness enhancing film of claim 32 wherein the inorganic nanoparticles are selected from the group consisting of zirconia, titania, and mixtures thereof.
34. The brightness enhancing film of claim 33 wherein the inorganic nanoparticle consist of zirconia.

35. A polymerizable resin composition having a refractive index of at least 1.58 comprising an organic component and at least 10 wt-% of surface modified inorganic nanoparticles wherein a cured film of the polymerizable resin composition has a tensile strength at break of at least 25 MPa and an elongation at break of at least 2%.

36. A polymerizable resin composition comprising an organic component and at least 10 wt-% of surface modified inorganic nanoparticles comprising adsorbed non-reactive volatile acid wherein a cured film of the polymerizable resin composition has a tensile strength at break of at least 25 MPa and an elongation at break of at least 2%.

37. A polymerizable resin composition comprising an organic component comprising one or more ethylenically unsaturated monomer(s) or oligomer(s); and at least 10 wt-% inorganic nanoparticles surface modified with a first surface treatment comprising at least one monocarboxylic acid having a non- reactive compatibilizing group, and a second surface treatment comprising at least one non-volatile monocarboxylic acid having a copolymerizable group that reacts with the organic component; wherein the nanoparticles comprise the second surface treatment in a stoichiometric amount than the first surface treatment.

38. A polymerizable resin composition comprising an organic component comprising one or more monofunctional biphenyl monomers in an amount totaling at least 10 wt-%; and at least 10 wt-% inorganic nanoparticles surface modified with i) at least one monocarboxylic acid having a water soluble tail, and ii) at least one acrylate functionalized surface modifier prepared by the reaction of an aliphatic anhydride and a hydroxy alkyl acrylate.
39. The polymerizable resin composition according to any one of claim 35-38 wherein the amount of inorganic nanoparticles ranges from 40 wt-% to 60 wt-%.
40. The polymerizable resin composition according to any one of claim 35-38 wherein the inorganic nanoparticles have a refractive index of at least 1.68.

41. The polymerizable resin composition according to any one of claims 35-38 wherein the polymerizable resin composition comprises 40 wt-% to 60 wt-% of surface modified inorganic nanoparticles, the nanoparticles having a refractive index of at least 1.68.
42. The polymerizable resin composition of claim 40 wherein the inorganic nanoparticles are selected from the group consisting of zirconia, titania, and mixtures thereof.

43. The polymerizable resin composition according to any one of claim 35-42 wherein the surface modified inorganic nanoparticles comprise adsorbed non-reactive volatile acid and the acid content of the brightness enhancing film is less than 5 wt-%.
44. The polymerizable resin composition according to any one of claim 35-42 wherein the polymerizable resin composition is free of silane surface treatments.
45. An optical article comprising the reaction product of the polymerizable composition of claim 35-42.
46. An optical film having a microstructured surface wherein the microstructured surface comprises the reaction product of the polymerizable composition of claim 45.

47. Inorganic nanoparticles surface modified with a first surface treatment comprising at least one monocarboxylic acid having a non- reactive compatibilizing group, and a second surface treatment comprising at least one non-volatile monocarboxylic acid having a copolymerizable group that reacts with the organic component; wherein the nanoparticles comprise the second surface treatment in a stoichiometric amount than the first surface treatment.
